title.narrative: Commitments on women, peace, security,justice, and humanitarian actions are shaped by women leadership to fulfill their rights and protection and are implemented by the Guatemalan State with UNW support.

description.narrative: • Women and girls contribute and have greater influence in building sustainable peace and resilience, and benefit equally from the prevention of natural disasters and conflicts and from humanitarian action. To fulfill its commitments in matters of Women, Peace, Security and access to justice to eradicate impunity and provide comprehensive reparation to women victims of armed conflict, UN Women substantially contributed by strengthening the capacities of state institutions. With support for the emblematic case of Sepur Zarco, key advances have been made for the transformative justice of women victims of sexual violence and slavery in the context of the armed conflict, as well the exchange of significant experiences that could be the foundation of new processes. The Sepur Zarco case which constitutes a breakthrough in global history, has contributed to global gender jurisprudence, generating well-founded knowledge on how to link the Rome Statute to the CPI, CEDAW GR 30, and Res. 1325.
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness
